commit_message:
Add "also-notifies" option

This patchset adds "also-notifies" option which is an optional part
of the "pools.yaml" configuration and should only be used to define
DNS servers other than the backend servers which should receive
notifications on zone changes.

Change-Id: I10faa6ec4ea4fd1f1f17c7234662cd5c23624c1d
Closes-Bug: 1758008

commit_message:
Properly set vios_ids when discovering initiator

If vios_ids were not passed to discover_initiator, they get set to
a list of vioses instead of a list of the ids.

Closes-bug: 1769919

commit_message:
Reinstate testing of changes to requirements.txt

Change I0c1328237d2109b1d1d5dcb40f331fff1ab10257 recently prevented
running kolla deployment CI jobs against changes to some files,
including requirements.txt. This change reinstates testing of changes to
requirements.txt, since this can have an effect on the operation of
kolla ansible.

Change-Id: I3d839de9aed60cddebea7d1140f618d3261cca2a

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I2f3e2821c4c6c68e378816ffc38f863394a45963

commit_message:
Add 'enable-notifications-designate' option

This patchset addss 'enable-notifications-designate' option which
enables 'notifications_designate' notification topic. The topic
should be only enabled in legacy deployments which use notification
topics for the purpose of integrating designate with nova and
neutron.

Change-Id: I1bed2327bf351cd0e56c657dd028ec26a4b68d60
Closes-Bug: #1659943

subject: Revert "Set optional API version-related environment vars"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-05-08 12:59:11.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/openstack_extras_auth_file_spec.rb', 'templates/openrc.erb', 'manifests/auth_file.pp'], 'message': 'Revert "Set optional API version-related environment vars"

This reverts commit 6d369703bb1778a11cf55fe679150928cb553cf6.
Before that commit, puppet-openstack was writing in /root/openrc:
export OS_IDENTITY_VERSION=3.1

Since this patch, it doesn't anymore, and everything in Debian is
completely broken: keystone bootstraping fails, image listing fails, etc.

I very much would enjoy having the feature of the reverted patch, but it
should never change the default behavior of setting OS_IDENTITY_VERSION.
I attempted to change the current behavior, keeping this patch, but
failed, so I suggest the original committer to just come back with a
better patch later on, once it's been reverted.

Change-Id: If833e6c9fe7d463e6270ef272295341bbf4c2570
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Set optional API version-related environment vars"

This reverts commit 6d369703bb1778a11cf55fe679150928cb553cf6.
Before that commit, puppet-openstack was writing in /root/openrc:
export OS_IDENTITY_VERSION=3.1

Since this patch, it doesn't anymore, and everything in Debian is
completely broken: keystone bootstraping fails, image listing fails, etc.

I very much would enjoy having the feature of the reverted patch, but it
should never change the default behavior of setting OS_IDENTITY_VERSION.
I attempted to change the current behavior, keeping this patch, but
failed, so I suggest the original committer to just come back with a
better patch later on, once it's been reverted.

Change-Id: If833e6c9fe7d463e6270ef272295341bbf4c2570

subject: Fix the gate jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-09 08:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'deploy-guide/source/multinode.rst', 'doc/source/user/quickstart.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Fix the gate jobs

This patch is including two patches to fix the gate.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail
(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the gate jobs

This patch is including two patches to fix the gate.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail
(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-08 16:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/keystone/keystone.spec.j2'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary BRs for keystone

Remove following not required BRs for keystone:-
- tempest
- os-api-ref
- reno
- python-subunit
- oslosphinx

Also add "openstackdocstheme" BR for docs and "which" for
tests.
"openstackdocstheme" was indirectly included by os-api-ref
and "which" by tempest before this patch.

Change-Id: Iebb73452d4a168f7469713b7f7afa71230988ff8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary BRs for keystone

Remove following not required BRs for keystone:-
- tempest
- os-api-ref
- reno
- python-subunit
- oslosphinx

Also add "openstackdocstheme" BR for docs and "which" for
tests.
"openstackdocstheme" was indirectly included by os-api-ref
and "which" by tempest before this patch.

Change-Id: Iebb73452d4a168f7469713b7f7afa71230988ff8

subject: Retry restarting systemd-journald
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-08 15:00:51.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': "Retry restarting systemd-journald

It is possible that systemd-journald fails to properly restart on
the first attempt due to assertion errors similar to the following:

  Assertion 'f' failed at src/journal/journal-file.c:132,
  function journal_file_close(). Aborting.

However, the service eventually starts with no problems, so we can
simply retry which will let it restart cleanly on the next attempt.

Change-Id: Ic65466b0d339c5a1b476e91483beca248ed0a02d
(cherry picked from commit 66ed618bce2c56a36e803d43ba6695dc3d64f0f3)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry restarting systemd-journald

It is possible that systemd-journald fails to properly restart on
the first attempt due to assertion errors similar to the following:

  Assertion 'f' failed at src/journal/journal-file.c:132,
  function journal_file_close(). Aborting.

However, the service eventually starts with no problems, so we can
simply retry which will let it restart cleanly on the next attempt.

Change-Id: Ic65466b0d339c5a1b476e91483beca248ed0a02d
(cherry picked from commit 66ed618bce2c56a36e803d43ba6695dc3d64f0f3)

commit_message:
Add designate-bind monitoring capability

This patch modifies Bind to listen also on localhost for rndc commands
so that monitoring agents can poll for status, and configuring Bind
to post statistical data in named.stats file.

	modified:   src/templates/named.conf
	modified:   src/templates/named.conf.options

Closes-Bug: #1752611
Change-Id: I219d29bfccb4565b8732882ee62aec9b847b3070

commit_message:
Add binary installation for PIP

This patch adds support in order to be able to install PIP from
the upstream repo.  Due to the fact that most binary deployemnts
currently ship some iteration of pip 8.x, change the integration
checks to make sure that we have pip 8.x rather than a pinned
version

Depends-On: I21d18b21b22ed263682477e50992eba9ebd00798
Change-Id: If3079823ad1ed7998dc5c91c554c78cdc99fffa5

commit_message:
Add Glance installation from binary

This patch adds support to install Glance from RDO with a few
differences from source installs

- Binary deploys don't install systemd files
- Binary deploys use upstream recommended deployment method
- Therefore, RDO installs will not use UWSGI.

Depends-On: If3079823ad1ed7998dc5c91c554c78cdc99fffa5
Change-Id: Ic5de80f92b04f279643d3a8a205da5fbe3a8bb63

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-20 07:33:52.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_swift_storage_utils.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: Ib5dcf2f389dd76f99d87ad22268695f2a702e6b3
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: Ib5dcf2f389dd76f99d87ad22268695f2a702e6b3

commit_message:
Ensure that comments are not counted

With the previous grep, it was possible that any commented nameserver
entries would be counted.  This patch fixes that.

Closes-Bug: #1768725

revisions:

In Ceph >= Luminous, application name needs to be set
on a per-pool level to avoid health warnings. This
change adds support for sending the application name
over the broker channel from consuming charms.

When a name is not sent from the other side of the
relation, the application name will be set to "unknown"
in Luminous and greater

Change-Id: I1109251b08da20adaf3d677c38fc1aacfba29439
Closes-Bug: #1753640
Depends-On: I99ae47b6802f50ea019751ffa328f11567cca567
'}]
commit_message:
Add broker support for passing app_name

In Ceph >= Luminous, application name needs to be set
on a per-pool level to avoid health warnings. This
change adds support for sending the application name
over the broker channel from consuming charms.

When a name is not sent from the other side of the
relation, the application name will be set to "unknown"
in Luminous and greater

Change-Id: I1109251b08da20adaf3d677c38fc1aacfba29439
Closes-Bug: #1753640
Depends-On: I99ae47b6802f50ea019751ffa328f11567cca567

commit_message:
tempest plugins only need to be installed on convert for newton

modify roles/convert-image/templates/convert_image.sh.j2
in tripleo-quickstart to selectively install tempest
packages, which are needed only for newton

Change to add the packages started here
https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/271048/ and was ported
to all the following evolutions.
It's needed only for newton.

Change-Id: I94fd32e7a7c7512f2a30c05ee45bc70645fb1613

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-30 14:10:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py', 'nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py'], 'message': 'Handle PortNotFoundClient exception when getting ports

There could be a race between deleting an instance and retrieving its
port groups from Neutron. In this case PortNotFoundClient is raised and
it can be safely ignored.

Change-Id: I31c9ea8628c6f3985f8e9118d9687bbfb8789b68
Closes-Bug: #1767058
'}]
commit_message:
Handle PortNotFoundClient exception when getting ports

There could be a race between deleting an instance and retrieving its
port groups from Neutron. In this case PortNotFoundClient is raised and
it can be safely ignored.

Change-Id: I31c9ea8628c6f3985f8e9118d9687bbfb8789b68
Closes-Bug: #1767058

get_tripleo_ansible_inventory assigning

subject: Relocate libvirt-sock from /run to /home
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24752, 'name': 'RedHat RDO Downstream CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins+downstream@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci-downstream', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-21 20:40:08.000000000', 'files': ['roles/undercloud-deploy/tasks/configure-vbmc.yml'], 'message': 'Relocate libvirt-sock from /run to /home

On one of the local test systems, quickstart.sh aborts when
trying to run "openstack overcloud node introspect" (in task
overcloud-prep-images). This happens because the VirtualBMC
service fails to start (virtualbmc@control_0.service etc.).
The service fails because it tests if the supplied URL for
libvirt is useable, and it's not. An access to it fails because
/run/user/1000 does not exist on the host.

Our speculation is that normally, we log in to stack@virthost
and run virsh, which starts libvirtd. The logging-in makes the
systemd-logind mount /run/user/1000, which is normal. When we
log out, libvirtd keeps the socket open and thus /run/user/1000
continues to exist. However, the system in question is so slow,
that libvirtd gets bored and exits, and systemd-logind umounts
the directory. When VBMC comes around to probe, the ssh connection
for qemu+ssh:// does not trigger systemd-logind and the directory
/run/user/1000 does not exist, which makes the proble to abort.

This is associated with "su - stack" not mounting /run/user/1000
(although ssh stack@virthost does so). It's a separate story why
that happens, the files in /etc/pam.d/ appear to require it
working, but something prevents it.

The fix or workaround for now is to avoid /run/user/1000 and
use the /home/stack/.cache, at least as long as we support
RHEL 7 and CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I92b5f0cc5f02aee275d80f41cb8fc920df6b1e14
'}]
commit_message:
Relocate libvirt-sock from /run to /home

On one of the local test systems, quickstart.sh aborts when
trying to run "openstack overcloud node introspect" (in task
overcloud-prep-images). This happens because the VirtualBMC
service fails to start (virtualbmc@control_0.service etc.).
The service fails because it tests if the supplied URL for
libvirt is useable, and it's not. An access to it fails because
/run/user/1000 does not exist on the host.

Our speculation is that normally, we log in to stack@virthost
and run virsh, which starts libvirtd. The logging-in makes the
systemd-logind mount /run/user/1000, which is normal. When we
log out, libvirtd keeps the socket open and thus /run/user/1000
continues to exist. However, the system in question is so slow,
that libvirtd gets bored and exits, and systemd-logind umounts
the directory. When VBMC comes around to probe, the ssh connection
for qemu+ssh:// does not trigger systemd-logind and the directory
/run/user/1000 does not exist, which makes the proble to abort.

This is associated with "su - stack" not mounting /run/user/1000
(although ssh stack@virthost does so). It's a separate story why
that happens, the files in /etc/pam.d/ appear to require it
working, but something prevents it.

The fix or workaround for now is to avoid /run/user/1000 and
use the /home/stack/.cache, at least as long as we support
RHEL 7 and CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I92b5f0cc5f02aee275d80f41cb8fc920df6b1e14

commit_message:
Decouple release from overcloud_release

Our workarounds were using release variable which defines
version of undercloud not overcloud. We need to make sure
we do overcloud workarounds on overcloud_release and
undercloud workarounds on release.

Change-Id: Id58685f2dca5821f0b1a7ee0da23e630bd6e6f49

subject: revist lifecycle_hook logic
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-05-07 13:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/actions/cluster_action.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/notifications/test_message.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/actions/test_delete.py', 'senlin/engine/notifications/message.py'], 'message': 'revist lifecycle_hook logic

    1. use one "Message" object to sink event
    2. add physical_id which is the actual to the event message
    3. check both node status and physical id before send event

    to reduce DB interactions

Change-Id: Ie34fa1a44b575644685dc400fd70deb160c5c2e5

commit_message:
revist lifecycle_hook logic

    1. use one "Message" object to sink event
    2. add physical_id which is the actual to the event message
    3. check both node status and physical id before send event
    4. remove the actions that can be executed immediately from "child"
    to reduce DB interactions

Change-Id: Ie34fa1a44b575644685dc400fd70deb160c5c2e5

commit_message:
Make UI accessable by default on OVB

A recent OVB commit[1] opens port 3000 and adds a stack output for the
private IP of the undercloud server.

This change uses that to bind the UI to the private IP of the
undercloud so that the UI can be accessed via
http://<floating ip>:3000

This change also makes the OVB git repo a variable so that local
development of OVB changes is easier.

[1] https://github.com/cybertron/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/1b6f33ab08ec29892ac557d3b1d318ef3fb4dc27

Change-Id: Ib51a038331d3d86da74af9f8c904d9a282087da0
Closes-Bug: #1719490

commit_message:
Allow OVB to attach undercloud to existing floating IP

Currently a different floating IP is created for every OVB deployment,
but it is convenient for development environments to allow for having
a stable IP for accessing the undercloud.

This change adds the undercloud_floating_ip and
undercloud_floating_ip_id parameters so that OVB
undercloud-floating-existing environment can be used as an alternative
to the default undercloud-floating.

Change-Id: Iad7e9e3c4da717fea28ec20e1d290a2510481a06

commit_message:
use virthost_user instead of non_root_user

in order to avoid confusion about which user is being used where,
tripleo-quickstart has replaced non_root_user with virthost_user and
undercloud_user.  This commit implements the same changes in
tripleo-quickstart-extras.

Change-Id: Ib68815660a633a987b80ea5e45627c0aa01c96f3

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24752, 'name': 'RedHat RDO Downstream CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins+downstream@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci-downstream', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-28 13:19:33.000000000', 'files': ['roles/overcloud-deploy/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/overcloud-deploy/README.md'], 'message': "Remove overcloud_services default value

...and document the expected structure in README instead.

This default value would not result in creating a sensible overcloud
deployment, and as such was not useful as a default. Also, replicating
the tripleo-heat-templates default here and keeping it in sync would be
a needless maintenance chore. Therefore should simply remove the
default.

If the user wants to set composable_services: true, they should also set
their own overcloud_services list. If they forget to do so, OOOQ should
fail.

The default case is already handled well by defaulting
composable_services to false. In that case we don't use
overcloud_services variable at all and the default set of services is
taken from what tripleo-heat-templates define.

Change-Id: I39dcee5b41fd430475ff87a5628c7c4b0ecbd762
"}]
commit_message:
Remove overcloud_services default value

...and document the expected structure in README instead.

This default value would not result in creating a sensible overcloud
deployment, and as such was not useful as a default. Also, replicating
the tripleo-heat-templates default here and keeping it in sync would be
a needless maintenance chore. Therefore should simply remove the
default.

If the user wants to set composable_services: true, they should also set
their own overcloud_services list. If they forget to do so, OOOQ should
fail.

The default case is already handled well by defaulting
composable_services to false. In that case we don't use
overcloud_services variable at all and the default set of services is
taken from what tripleo-heat-templates define.

Change-Id: I39dcee5b41fd430475ff87a5628c7c4b0ecbd762

commit_message:

commit_message:
WIP: Give build-test-packages role the option to inject

This commit gives the build-test-packages role a new option: to specify
a package to be built in addition to sourcing from Zuul and Jenkins.
This would primarily be used to replicate failures and test fixes in a
CI scenario.

Change-Id: Ic74b52008c3ebaabecaf7e019013e5cf634654e8

commit_message:
Switch to Tempest run cli for running tempest

* tempest run command does not having *tempest_until_failure*
  flag. So it needs to be removed also.

* Currently ostestr is switched to stestr which breaks the stuff.
  It is better to switched to tempest run in order to avoid the
  effect.

Change-Id: Id7cbf37e9e98811271410d0ea04c87d5299c83e7

commit_message:
WIP: Add stack update role

This commit provides a role to run stack update operations and change
overcloud parameters. This will be useful for testing vairous
overcloud settings change possibilities in a CI setting.

Example usage:

- name: Run stack update with compute updates
  hosts: undercloud
  vars:
    - update_compute_nodes: true
  roles:
    - update-stack

Change-Id: I765c4d11da5f34c449cbcdcba97567f515d7051d

commit_message:
Use clean keystone URL in the keystone validation

Inventory variable overcloud_keystone_url gets its
value from stack's output 'KeystoneURL'
which might include the keystone version.
We need to get rid off the version, otherwise
undercloud validations fail at the time of
checking the Keystone endpoint [0].

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-validations/blob/545e4924e30769eb06100be1b5b2cd64637cf76e/validations/openstack-endpoints.yaml#L28

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Story: #2001897

Change-Id: I3e900afd840a4a0504a573a1eabe80911f8f7881
(cherry picked from commit c8cefbd9e97e84c0525259d93256c26069bc4a95)

commit_message:
Autofencing support

With this change we introduce the 'enable_autofencing' parameter which
defaults to false. When enabled we create a fencing_config.yaml file
which contains all the necessary information for the overcloud to
configure IPMI-based stonith devices.

In order for the virtualbmc IPMI ports to be reachable we also create
an iptables rule to open up those ports for the overcloud.

With this option on, we correctly get stonith autoconfigured:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs stonith
 stonith-fence_ipmilan-00b723a39acb (stonith:fence_ipmilan): Started overcloud-controller-0
 stonith-fence_ipmilan-00b723a39ac7 (stonith:fence_ipmilan): Started overcloud-controller-1
 stonith-fence_ipmilan-00b723a39ac3 (stonith:fence_ipmilan): Started overcloud-controller-2

Depends-On: I0727a9224b5e9eaafaa374ecfbcd4fb9ccb52d58
Change-Id: Ia5a6e3b6ee328b290127e2842ff27effe6f786ee

commit_message:

An empty file (validate-template-override.yaml)
will be created when using 'echo', which in turn
causes pingtest fail.

commit_message:
Use testr failing --list to determine tempest status

* on running testr failing --list exit status will return 0
  if all the tests are passed and if any tests has failed. It will
  list failing tests and exit status will be 1.

* It is the best way to determine the tempest run status.

Change-Id: I5d3230368463ce40114541a5eda409b49df8d360

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2018-02-05 20:51:52.000000000', 'files': ['roles/repo-setup/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/fetch-images/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/repo-setup/defaults/main.yml', 'quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'Support release change during playbook run

Sometimes it's neeeded to change release of tripleo distribution
during the run (in upgrades for example), this patch add suppoort
for this:
 - Remove enforcing of release from quickstart.sh
 - Move default release to repo-setup role
 - Use include_vars in repo-setup role for loading release vars,
   passing var "release_config" to role will define which release
   file will be included.
 - Continue support of -R|--release argument in quickstart, it will
   remain for backward compatibility and running playbooks with one
   release only.

Change-Id: Ia62281c232e6ccaee4feaeb01b5c9a122350bf64
'}]
commit_message:
Support release change during playbook run

Sometimes it's neeeded to change release of tripleo distribution
during the run (in upgrades for example), this patch add suppoort
for this:
 - Remove enforcing of release from quickstart.sh
 - Move default release to repo-setup role
 - Use include_vars in repo-setup role for loading release vars,
   passing var "release_config" to role will define which release
   file will be included.
 - Continue support of -R|--release argument in quickstart, it will
   remain for backward compatibility and running playbooks with one
   release only.

Change-Id: Ia62281c232e6ccaee4feaeb01b5c9a122350bf64

This patch allows specifying a disk Serial and/or WWN for the overcloud
VMs. Ironic has a feature called "root device hints" which allows
operators to use disk attributes such as: model, size, serial, wwn,
etc... to specify which disk the image should be deployed onto.

By allowing it to be specified we can then exercise this feature from
Ironic with tripleo-quickstart.

This patch also changes the default disk controller from virtio to scsi
in the overcloud nodes because such attributes are not part of virtio in

Closes-Bug: #1645673

commit_message:
Allow customizing the hard-drive Serial and/or WWN

This patch allows specifying a disk Serial and/or WWN for the overcloud
VMs. Ironic has a feature called "root device hints" which allows
operators to use disk attributes such as: model, size, serial, wwn,
etc... to specify which disk the image should be deployed onto.

By allowing it to be specified we can then exercise this feature from
Ironic with tripleo-quickstart.

This patch also changes the default disk controller from virtio to scsi
in the overcloud nodes because such attributes are not part of virtio in
libvirt.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4d862ee0c16f679a117c20201c6a884224586b25
Closes-Bug: #1645673

commit_message:
Decouple release from overcloud_release

Our workarounds were using release variable which defines
version of undercloud not overcloud. We need to make sure
we do overcloud workarounds on overcloud_release and
undercloud workarounds on release.

Change-Id: Ibcf65485e5f1793a4b005bee73e0d42925b3a442

commit_message:
Enable the image signing feature in scenario 2

Adding this tempest option will force python-tempestconf to
create signed images in the test environment.  This is needed
so that tests will continue to pass when glance signature
vverification is enabled in nova.

Depends-On: I7186e5904bf5c4843b85436c2d081e50007931ff
Change-Id: Ie62025da5bd3ea495ef706f2cd18860a94c27e16

commit_message:
modify basic test to use non-default non_root_user

we expect operators to be able to set non_root_user in their
configuration, but we do not respect this value in our playbooks.
This modifies basic.sh to us  a non-default value for non_root_user to
flush out these issues.

Change-Id: I98487b98fea5f6549790bebb4da744d07f68eed3

While this option itself was not technically deprecated,

And was removed in Rocky:

  I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c

is also the default, it's not really an option anymore and

commit_message:
Remove [scheduler]/host_manager config option

While this option itself was not technically deprecated,
the option only had two choices and the "ironic_host_manager"
choice has been deprecated since Queens:

  Iebc74a09990dcda8cf0ee2a41f9ae1058d2a182a

And was removed in Rocky:

  I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c

Since the host_manager option only had one choice, which
is also the default, it's not really an option anymore and
we can simply remove it. Setting it will have no effect
so there should be no upgrade impact for its removal.

Change-Id: Ic61ae3a4f563aa54a3a2956667c702a81e610fc3

commit_message:
Rename objectstorage flavor to swift-storage

Actually it's called swift-storage in TripleO, and it makes sense to use
the same name within TripleO quickstart to simplify testing.

Also add a Swift config to simplify testing.

Change-Id: I48358ab8e5f5445e6ba6e87f782d503645f64ae9

subject: improve generated ssh configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-04 18:01:27.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config.j2'], 'message': 'improve generated ssh configuration

When deploying an environment using a pre-existing inventory, the
quickstart could produce incorrect ssh configuration files because the
conditions in the templates would key off the presence or absence of
things like the ansible_host and ansible_user variables, which may not
existing for simple inventories.

This patch introduces sane defaults in the absence of those variables.

Change-Id: I955aa3db0ba21e8360ecf5c058009810680fbd92
Closes-bug: #1631125
Closes-bug: #1631124
'}]
commit_message:
improve generated ssh configuration

When deploying an environment using a pre-existing inventory, the
quickstart could produce incorrect ssh configuration files because the
conditions in the templates would key off the presence or absence of
things like the ansible_host and ansible_user variables, which may not
existing for simple inventories.

This patch introduces sane defaults in the absence of those variables.

Change-Id: I955aa3db0ba21e8360ecf5c058009810680fbd92
Closes-bug: #1631125
Closes-bug: #1631124

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-04 18:01:27.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config.j2', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/templates/ssh.config.j2', 'roles/tripleo-inventory/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/customize_overcloud.yml', 'roles/libvirt/teardown/nodes/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/convert-image/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/overcloud/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/provision/teardown/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/provision/remote/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/templates/undercloudvm.xml.j2', 'roles/provision/local/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/inject_gating_repo.yml', 'roles/provision/user/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/tripleo-inventory/meta/main.yml', 'roles/common/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/provision/remote/templates/libvirt.pkla.j2', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/inject_repos.yml', 'roles/environment/setup/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/update_image.yml', 'roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config_no_undercloud.j2'], 'message': 'restore support for multiple deployments on virthost

some confusion has developed in the tripleo-quickstart involving user
names and working directories, resulting in a situation that worked
only because we were defaulting to identical values on both the
virthost and the undercloud.  when attemping to deploy multiple
tripleo-quickstart environments under different user ids on the same
virthost this would cause the deployment to fail.

this changes attempts to cleanly separate those concerns:

- instead of the nebulous names "non_root_user" and "ssh_user", we now
  have "virthost_user" and "undercloud_user".

- we have "virthost_working_dir" and "undercloud_working_dir"

- some tasks have been relocated from provision to libvirt/setup,
  reflecting the fact that they need to run per-remote-user rather
  than per-remote-host

Change-Id: Ib1d4177ca54ef341a92d3b3d7b637922d572b31d
Closes-bug: #1631119
Closes-bug: #1631120
'}]
commit_message:
restore support for multiple deployments on virthost

some confusion has developed in the tripleo-quickstart involving user
names and working directories, resulting in a situation that worked
only because we were defaulting to identical values on both the
virthost and the undercloud.  when attemping to deploy multiple
tripleo-quickstart environments under different user ids on the same
virthost this would cause the deployment to fail.

this changes attempts to cleanly separate those concerns:

- instead of the nebulous names "non_root_user" and "ssh_user", we now
  have "virthost_user" and "undercloud_user".

- we have "virthost_working_dir" and "undercloud_working_dir"

- some tasks have been relocated from provision to libvirt/setup,
  reflecting the fact that they need to run per-remote-user rather
  than per-remote-host

Change-Id: Ib1d4177ca54ef341a92d3b3d7b637922d572b31d
Closes-bug: #1631119
Closes-bug: #1631120

commit_message:
exclude python-dns from delorean-pike-testing

The python-dns package listed in the delorean-pike-testing repository
prevents installation of the latest version from centos-base (due to
repo priorities).

Change-Id: I8a3b82831891b757f713cbe4599c4ff67d57b064
Closes-bug: #1717550

Change-Id: I42d647e361dea75082173244637b4ef18f8b1b99

commit_message:
neutron, nova: fixed multiple mechanism drivers support

Done:
- removed network.backed which is duplicate to ml2 mechanism drivers
- fixed not to mount unnecessary config files for dhcp, l3, and metadata agents
- added a new node label indicating what kind of l2 agent to run
- set interface_driver based on the new node label
  (fixed interface_driver not to take multiple values)
- fixed dependency for nova-compute, dhcp-agent, l3-agent and metadata-agent
  by ensuring l2 agent pod is running locally
- minor changes on values.yaml

To Do:
- consider the case where normal and direct(sriov) ports reside on the same node
- eliminate assumptions on core_plugin=ml2

Change-Id: I42d647e361dea75082173244637b4ef18f8b1b99

subject: tox.ini: Use python3.5 in py35 environment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-08 00:39:26.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "tox.ini: Use python3.5 in py35 environment

When stuff fails it tends to fail in different ways on different
versions of python. It's very unhelpful if 'tox -epy35' means a
different thing on every developer's machine, which is what tends to
happen if you use python3 as the basepython.

Change-Id: I4f92cd6bb22e36b1c49436eca1849712682aec68
"}]
commit_message:
tox.ini: Use python3.5 in py35 environment

When stuff fails it tends to fail in different ways on different
versions of python. It's very unhelpful if 'tox -epy35' means a
different thing on every developer's machine, which is what tends to
happen if you use python3 as the basepython.

Change-Id: I4f92cd6bb22e36b1c49436eca1849712682aec68

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I46fd53fe70c4e63e5b06043bd650a2d6dc7e9ff1

These are self-explanatory, with some exceptions:

- IntOpt does not take a 'choices' parameter
- 'connection' cannot have a 'required' parameter as not all nodes
  need it and it would break upgrades
- Some of the defaults suggested weren't actually defaults in oslo.db

Change-Id: Id3bb4224a30f2abe26c89af6bc5546127c4db739
"}]
commit_message:
conf: Resolve TODOs in 'database'

These are self-explanatory, with some exceptions:

- IntOpt does not take a 'choices' parameter
- 'connection' cannot have a 'required' parameter as not all nodes
  need it and it would break upgrades
- Some of the defaults suggested weren't actually defaults in oslo.db

Change-Id: Id3bb4224a30f2abe26c89af6bc5546127c4db739

commit_message:
objects: remove pagesize from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

Removes the initialization of pagesize to None when creating new
instances of InstanceNUMATopology. This necessitates checking for the
presence of the field before using it. The current pattern allowed us to
avoid this check, at the expense of not being able to inspect objects
easily and consistently generate a list of fields.

As part of this change, a bug in tests for overcommitting of NUMA cells
was uncovered. The tests are reworked to resolve this and documentation
added in case people find the feature as confusing as I did initially.

Change-Id: I11392bb5bcb4427faae3cb8bba2d615271203e81
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

Removes the initialization of 'cpu_pinning', 'cpu_policy' and
'cpu_thread_policy' when creating object InstanceNUMATopology. The

also allows us to fix two bugs:

- Fix backwards compatibility for InstanceNUMACell

  Pre-1.3 versions of InstanceNUMACell didn't have a 'cpu_policy' field.

commit_message:
objects: remove related pinning from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

Removes the initialization of 'cpu_pinning', 'cpu_policy' and
'cpu_thread_policy' when creating object InstanceNUMATopology. The
current pattern allowed us to avoid some checks but meant we could
easily inspect objects and consistently generate a list of fields. This
also allows us to fix two bugs:

- Fix backwards compatibility for InstanceNUMACell

  Pre-1.3 versions of InstanceNUMACell didn't have a 'cpu_policy' field.
  However, after this, the 'cpu_pinning_requested' function was changed
  to rely on this variable. This is resolved through the reinstatement
  of the pre-1.3 check for pre-1.3 objects versions.

- Fix a faulty unit test

  We should check 'nova_object.data', not the primitive itself.

Change-Id: Iac4c6895c7059fa095906304a7e74c0c89057cd2
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Resolves-bug: #1636338

commit_message:
objects: remove cpuset_reserved from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

This commit removes the initialization of cpuset_reserved to None when
creating object InstanceNUMATopology. The current pattern allowed us to
avoid some checks but meant we could inspect objects easily and
consistently generate a list of fields.

Change-Id: I31937b288a9549341426d2e619aae39b3e8550c7

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-24 04:34:00.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/builddoc.py'], 'message': 'Fix builddoc with sphinx <= 1.6

I went to build infra-specs which specifies sphinx==1.5.6 and hit

 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "setup.py", line 29, in <module>
     pbr=True)
   ...
  File ".../pbr/builddoc.py", line 235, in run
    self._sphinx_run()
  File ".../pbr/builddoc.py", line 162, in _sphinx_run
    freshenv=self.fresh_env, warningiserror=self.warning_is_error)
  File ".../sphinx/application.py", line 244, in __init__
    self._init_builder(self.buildername)
  File "...//sphinx/application.py", line 311, in _init_builder
    raise SphinxError('Builder name %s not registered' % buildername)
 sphinx.errors.SphinxError: Builder name h not registered

It appears to be a typo introduced with
I18bbf693bca2f6e49d822ae2940d2170a2b90ce9; make sure we're walking the
self.builders list; not the string self.builder.

Change-Id: Ic038029c361b3ede48f2b495c74430d3ad1eab82
'}]
commit_message:
Fix builddoc with sphinx <= 1.6

I went to build infra-specs which specifies sphinx==1.5.6 and hit

 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "setup.py", line 29, in <module>
     pbr=True)
   ...
  File ".../pbr/builddoc.py", line 235, in run
    self._sphinx_run()
  File ".../pbr/builddoc.py", line 162, in _sphinx_run
    freshenv=self.fresh_env, warningiserror=self.warning_is_error)
  File ".../sphinx/application.py", line 244, in __init__
    self._init_builder(self.buildername)
  File "...//sphinx/application.py", line 311, in _init_builder
    raise SphinxError('Builder name %s not registered' % buildername)
 sphinx.errors.SphinxError: Builder name h not registered

It appears to be a typo introduced with
I18bbf693bca2f6e49d822ae2940d2170a2b90ce9; make sure we're walking the
self.builders list; not the string self.builder.

Change-Id: Ic038029c361b3ede48f2b495c74430d3ad1eab82

commit_message:
Add ssh-user to get_tripleo_ansible_inventory

We were missing --ssh-user when calling
get_tripleo_ansible_inventory assigning
overcloud as the ssh_user by default.

This is failing after adding the --stack option
as he had only one before

Change-Id: I447a050ce67d626e7050a22c9821f883ebeda2ee
Closes-Bug: 1767379
Closes-Bug: 1769974

subject: Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 07:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)
'}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

commit_message:
Fix the gate jobs

This patch including two backport commits.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail

(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb

subject: Take control of when `ceph-create-keys` is run
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-08 11:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['ceph/utils.py'], 'message': 'Take control of when `ceph-create-keys` is run

For Ceph versions prior to Luminous the `ceph-create-keys`
is run by the init system in conjunction with starting the
ceph-mon service.

At some point during the Hammer lifetime a hard coded timeout
of 600 seconds was added:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/8bab74537f5891f2b97f0fb6722e2e00416b723a

In many circumstances this is not enough.  With this commit
we take control of running this command.

__NOTE__ it is important that charms deploying the ceph-mon
disable running of `ceph-create-keys` from the init system.

From Luminous and onwards we can use the newly added --timeout
flag.  For previous versions we rely on retry_on_exception
decorator.

Change-Id: I3d3c7298076730c423ca5cc059316619f415b885
Related-Bug: #1719436
'}]
commit_message:
Take control of when `ceph-create-keys` is run

For Ceph versions prior to Luminous the `ceph-create-keys`
is run by the init system in conjunction with starting the
ceph-mon service.

At some point during the Hammer lifetime a hard coded timeout
of 600 seconds was added:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/8bab74537f5891f2b97f0fb6722e2e00416b723a

In many circumstances this is not enough.  With this commit
we take control of running this command.

__NOTE__ it is important that charms deploying the ceph-mon
disable running of `ceph-create-keys` from the init system.

From Luminous and onwards we can use the newly added --timeout
flag.  For previous versions we rely on retry_on_exception
decorator.

Change-Id: I3d3c7298076730c423ca5cc059316619f415b885
Related-Bug: #1719436

Add test Migrating a volume from created snapshot

This patch is uploaded, since there was a bug while
migrating/retyping a volume created from snapshot to a
different backend after snapshot got deleted.

subject: Fix sphinx-docs job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-04 12:00:04.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh'], 'message': 'Fix sphinx-docs job

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

This patch is necessary until the tox_install.sh removal [1] is merged in.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555788

Change-Id: I69663be876def03f47594c838591cfdb10d00871
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

This patch is necessary until the tox_install.sh removal [1] is merged in.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555788

Change-Id: I69663be876def03f47594c838591cfdb10d00871

commit_message:
Generate and mount wrappers for neutron agent processes

The neutron agents use things like dnsmasq and keepalived as part of
their implementation. Running these "subprocesses" in separate
containers prevent dataplane breakages/unnecessary failover on agent
container restart. This patch triggers the creation and mounting of
wrappers for launching these processes in containers.

Related-Bug: #1749209
Depends-On: Icd4c24ac686d957391548a04722266cefc1bce27
Depends-On: I8d93f4eccde1dc6e55e10399184ee80671355769
Depends-On: Ib2d2ad4960ea34ec9e3fca1eeb322742341f7eb7
Change-Id: Iea53489c916765bcfd88d7d12e6a32e1b6276d81

commit_message:
Avoid running kolla source jobs for unnecessary  files

While fixing test-requirement.txt, I found that
check pipeline can be more optimized in term of selecting
the jobs to run based on file change.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567083/
kolla main jobs are not needed to be run on check
pipeline for test-requirements.txt, releasenotes/* etc.

This commit skip those jobs when only above files
are changed in patch. This is will save time as well
as infra resource also.

Change-Id: I0c1328237d2109b1d1d5dcb40f331fff1ab10257

commit_message:
Updated tests on bug, when get list returns deleted items

In I4d2f44fa149aee564c62a69822c6ad79de5bba8a we introduced new
_get_model_list method that introduces unify way for retrieving models
from db. This commit adds tests that do checks on bug 1761956, when
selecting with filter() method could return deleted entites.

Change-Id: I12df4af70bcc25654a0fb276ea7145d772d891e2
Related-Bug: 1761956

commit_message:
Fix the gate with backport packages

This patch is including two patches to fix the gate.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Change-Id: I05e49bbcef564ad4f3d80f0649ccf191d9f8b59d

commit_message:
Don't install criu for arm64/s390x prior to artful

The criu package doesn't exist for arm64/s390x prior to artful,
causing an install hook failure. Let's not attempt to install
it when that is the case.

Change-Id: If0cc517d9e607604e427aab385fabd8a9a193fdf
Closes-Bug: #1748235

subject: Added _get_model_list base method for all get_*_list methods
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-10 11:12:26.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Added _get_model_list base method for all get_*_list methods

When we call audittemplate list without filters, it returns all Audit
Templates that are not deleted, as expected. If we add any filter to
query and context.show_deleted is None (we request only current AT),
query.filter_by adds filter to joined table (for example, goals, results
 in a query like JOIN goals ... WHERE ... goals.deleted_at IS NULL) not
to model's table (AuditTemplate in our case).

We change call for filter_by to filter, explicitly point to model that
we want to filter.

Also, we moved query generating code to new method _get_model_list(). As
a result we applied same fix to all of the other models.

Change-Id: I4d2f44fa149aee564c62a69822c6ad79de5bba8a
Closes-bug: 1761956
"}]
commit_message:
Added _get_model_list base method for all get_*_list methods

When we call audittemplate list without filters, it returns all Audit
Templates that are not deleted, as expected. If we add any filter to
query and context.show_deleted is None (we request only current AT),
query.filter_by adds filter to joined table (for example, goals, results
 in a query like JOIN goals ... WHERE ... goals.deleted_at IS NULL) not
to model's table (AuditTemplate in our case).

We change call for filter_by to filter, explicitly point to model that
we want to filter.

Also, we moved query generating code to new method _get_model_list(). As
a result we applied same fix to all of the other models.

Change-Id: I4d2f44fa149aee564c62a69822c6ad79de5bba8a
Closes-bug: 1761956

commit_message:
Enable the HA deployment by default

With the HA NG work having landed, the impact of pacemaker
is reduced and only very few core services are being managed
by pacemaker. Since the HA deployments work just fine
with a single node, it makes little sense to use the non-ha
deployment as default any longer (Also because downstream
we do the default to the HA deployment by default and this
keeps confusing users)

The change in OOOQ-extras try to
change the way the pacemaker env files are used.

Depends-On: I3a486d22b30ffdb6053b3d917dea373c1361df81
Change-Id: Ibfc86bc6e7f589a20fc82ad161d69e5c8c7a8cb8

commit_message:
IBM XIV: enable FC zoning to all the ports

Define FC host just considers connected FC target ports, which should
enable host to connect to all the storage FC ports for zoning.

Change-Id: Ibb20917c8ed80cb1413de1d61104d495605ec3df
Closes-Bug:#1759994

subject: Add NetworkErrorException for socket.error
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-30 01:58:57.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/exceptions.py', 'tempest_lib/common/rest_client.py', 'tempest_lib/tests/fake_http.py', 'tempest_lib/tests/test_rest_client.py'], 'message': 'Add NetworkErrorException for socket.error

Sometimes rest_client can meet connection refused socket error
if the server is not listening on socket port yet. This patch
maps this error to NetworkErrorException so up layer caller can
handle it properly.

Change-Id: I946026221ded380b55d566ed9b1346e58386d167
'}]
commit_message:
Add NetworkErrorException for socket.error

Sometimes rest_client can meet connection refused socket error
if the server is not listening on socket port yet. This patch
maps this error to NetworkErrorException so up layer caller can
handle it properly.

Change-Id: I946026221ded380b55d566ed9b1346e58386d167

subject: Add volumes_links attribute in list_volumes schema
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-28 06:28:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/volumes.py'], 'message': 'Add volumes_links attribute in list_volumes schema

When GETting os-volumes, the returned list of volumes respects the
osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to
the next element in the list. But volumes_links attribute not allowd in
volume list. We need to add volumes_links attribute in tempest.

Implements: blueprint resource-links-attribute-add
Change-Id: I8721b9648e22273232b108c67250749eda6c506a
Closes-Bug: 1504641
'}]
commit_message:
Add volumes_links attribute in list_volumes schema

When GETting os-volumes, the returned list of volumes respects the
osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to
the next element in the list. But volumes_links attribute not allowd in
volume list. We need to add volumes_links attribute in tempest.

Implements: blueprint resource-links-attribute-add

subject: Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 01:01:56.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
'}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-02 15:42:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/conf/scheduler.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-baremetal-filters-52db06d597645d00.yaml', 'setup.cfg', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Remove IronicHostManager and baremetal scheduling options

The use_baremetal_filters and baremetal_enabled_filters were
deprecated in Pike: I843353427c90142a366ae9ca63ee4298b4f3ecd4

The IronicHostManager was deprecated in Queens:
Iebc74a09990dcda8cf0ee2a41f9ae1058d2a182a

Note that the NUMATopologyFilter should be OK in a mixed
VM/BM deployment because ironic compute nodes will not
report 'numa_topology' so those "hosts" will be filtered
out from requests for a specific NUMA topology or CPU
policy.

This change drops the deprecated baremetal scheduling options
and since the IronicHostManager is really only useful when
using those scheduling options, it is also removed.

Baremetal scheduling is now required to go through resource
classes.

Change-Id: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove IronicHostManager and baremetal scheduling options

The use_baremetal_filters and baremetal_enabled_filters were
deprecated in Pike: I843353427c90142a366ae9ca63ee4298b4f3ecd4

The IronicHostManager was deprecated in Queens:
Iebc74a09990dcda8cf0ee2a41f9ae1058d2a182a

Note that the NUMATopologyFilter should be OK in a mixed
VM/BM deployment because ironic compute nodes will not
report 'numa_topology' so those "hosts" will be filtered
out from requests for a specific NUMA topology or CPU
policy.

This change drops the deprecated baremetal scheduling options
and since the IronicHostManager is really only useful when
using those scheduling options, it is also removed.

Baremetal scheduling is now required to go through resource
classes.

Change-Id: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c

[{'number': 24, 'created': '2017-07-07 14:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test-orig.sh'], 'message': 'Enable the HA deployment by default

With the HA NG work having landed, the impact of pacemaker

deployment as default any longer (Also because downstream

commit_message:
Enable the HA deployment by default

With the HA NG work having landed, the impact of pacemaker
is reduced and only very few core services are being managed
by pacemaker. Since the HA deployments work just fine
with a single node, it makes little sense to use the non-ha
deployment as default any longer (Also because downstream
we do the default to the HA deployment by default and this
keeps confusing users)

This is the related CI change and we basically now remove -e
puppet-pacemaker.yaml as it is the default and explicitely
set -e nonha-arch.yaml for the non-ha jobs.

Depends-On: I3a486d22b30ffdb6053b3d917dea373c1361df81
Change-Id: I5ff78b0b02b952bfba3c3bc512ffa77da3227b78

commit_message:
Use --config when we manipulate the CIB

Not using --config can potentially trigger reprobes and generally
make things slower. Let's add --config during a push.
I will only push the CIB portion related to the resources themselves
and not their (or the cluster's) state.

Change-Id: Id6d671c5db95c33c98848731e2c412d952bff65c

commit_message:
WIP Precreate /var/log/pacemaker/bundles

Until the following BZ hits Centos/RHEL we are better off creating the folders
ourselves so that the system_u:object_r:var_log_t:s0 context is used on the folder
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1508360. Once this BZ has been released
we can remove this directory creation code.

Without this fix selinux will block the logging of the HA containers.

Change-Id: Ia74683a4c3e61a4388f15da48ba567258979a740

subject: WIP DNR Add /usr bind mount to pacemaker init_bundles
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-18 09:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/pacemaker/rabbitmq.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-volume.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/database/mysql.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/database/redis.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-backup.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/manila-share.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/ovn-dbs.yaml'], 'message': "WIP DNR Add /usr bind mount to pacemaker init_bundles

The reason for this is that when we will update to a newer pacemaker
version (for example during a RHEL minor update) there will be a new
xml schema on the host for pacemaker.

Currently we run pcs commands inside a container we potentially run
commands with an old pcs and old pacemaker libs/commands. If on the
host we have a newer pacemaker version we can get the following errors:
Error: unable to get crm_config
cibadmin: Connection to local file '/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-uhtnl3' failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Signon to CIB failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Init failed, could not perform requested operations
Error: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib
Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Stonith/Pacemaker::Property[Disable STONITH]/Pcmk_property[property--stonith-enabled]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib

Change-Id: I0df2cf563985e3fdfc00146a42caf18db3456acd
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
WIP DNR Add /usr bind mount to pacemaker init_bundles

The reason for this is that when we will update to a newer pacemaker
version (for example during a RHEL minor update) there will be a new
xml schema on the host for pacemaker.

Currently we run pcs commands inside a container we potentially run
commands with an old pcs and old pacemaker libs/commands. If on the
host we have a newer pacemaker version we can get the following errors:
Error: unable to get crm_config
cibadmin: Connection to local file '/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-uhtnl3' failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Signon to CIB failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Init failed, could not perform requested operations
Error: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib
Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Stonith/Pacemaker::Property[Disable STONITH]/Pcmk_property[property--stonith-enabled]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib

Change-Id: I0df2cf563985e3fdfc00146a42caf18db3456acd
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-14 19:33:12.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': 'Disable libvirtd on the undercloud

Sometimes libvirtd can race with the iptables service when setting upthe
iptables rules. The iptables service will fail with:

    ERROR: problem running iptables: Another app is currently holding the xtables lock. Perhaps you want to use the -w option?

We do not need libvirtd on the undercloud in any case so add it to the
disabled services.

Change-Id: I28f50b73e89fd89f34d181d950fa8ddab57fa61c
'}]
commit_message:
Disable libvirtd on the undercloud

Sometimes libvirtd can race with the iptables service when setting upthe
iptables rules. The iptables service will fail with:

    ERROR: problem running iptables: Another app is currently holding the xtables lock. Perhaps you want to use the -w option?

We do not need libvirtd on the undercloud in any case so add it to the
disabled services.

Change-Id: I28f50b73e89fd89f34d181d950fa8ddab57fa61c

commit_message:
Refactor watcher API for Action Plan Start

Currently the REST API to start action plan in watcher
is which is same as for update action plan.

PATCH /v1/action_plans

https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/latest/api/v1.html

we need to make it easy to understand like :

POST /v1/action_plans/{action_plan_uuid}/start

the action should be start in above case.
Change-Id: I5353e4aa58d1675d8afb94bea35d9b953514129a
Closes-Bug: #1756274

subject: Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-02 10:36:33.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py'], 'message': 'Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755

commit_message:
Use clean keystone URL in the keystone validation

Inventory variable overcloud_keystone_url gets its
value from stack's output 'KeystoneURL'
which might include the keystone version.
We need to get rid off the version, otherwise
undercloud validations fail at the time of
checking the Keystone endpoint [0].

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-validations/blob/545e4924e30769eb06100be1b5b2cd64637cf76e/validations/openstack-endpoints.yaml#L28

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Story: #2001897

Change-Id: I3e900afd840a4a0504a573a1eabe80911f8f7881

commit_message:
Add Apmec project to OpenStack (Part 1)

Apmec stands for an Automated Platform for Multi-access computing,
which is OpenStack based MEC Orchestration framework.
Apmec is the first open-source project that is motivated by ETSI MEC
framework and reference architecture [1] in order to aim at
providing the lifecycle management of MEC applications.

[1] http://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/MEC/001_099/003/01.01.01_60/gs_MEC003v010101p.pdf

Change-Id: I47e0654ebc9d64ec426b5cf69a60b1ad38ddc42a
Signed-off-by: Tung Doan <tung.doan_van@tu-dresden.de>

subject: WIP DNR Do not restart the docker service on stack updates
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 21537, 'name': 'Yurii Prokulevych', 'email': 'yprokule@redhat.com', 'username': 'yprokule'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-17 15:19:59.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/docker.pp'], 'message': "WIP DNR Do not restart the docker service on stack updates

Restarting the docker service seemingly has a number of negative
implications on an overcloud. When we added --live-restore to docker
we assumed that we were covered in most cases. The only left out
case was the 'upgrade the docker rpm' one, where we actually
stopped all containers, stopped docker, upgraded the packages
and then started docker again (this was done with the minor updates
task)

The problem with restarting docker (apparently only with the
--live-restore) seems to be that we actually get the daemon in a hanging
state (see RHBZ#1566439 and the many deadlock mentions on github).

So let's prototype a way to actually *not* restart the docker service
when a configuration change happens.

Let's consider four scenarios:
A) Initial deploy
This is untouched by the patch and works as before

B) Re-deploy against an existing overcloud
This is probably one of the most problematic ones, because the following
might happen.
B.1) A docker config change will trigger a docker service restart
B.2) The docker service restart will happen more or less at the same
time on all controller nodes.
B.3) Massive service desruption ensues and potentially pacemaker will
fail resources as well and can potentially fence nodes if stopping
a resource fails.

With this patch we'd avoid this situation by simply never restarting
docker (it can still be restarted via a minor update workflow)

C) Minor updates
Here if we detect a config change via puppet or a docker package upgrade
we do the following:
C.1) We stop all containers and then docker
C.2) We update the package
C.3) We rerun puppet
C.4) We start docker

With this patch we need to make sure that we do not rely on puppet to
start the service but we need to do it via ansible in the update
task.

D) Major upgrades
We would not restart docker. It would be restarted (if needed) via a
minor update (either the one before the major upgrade, or one
afterwards)

Change-Id: I75a0e200b96cc5057c95d7f892eb9f23bb97a042
"}]
commit_message:
WIP DNR Do not restart the docker service on stack updates

Restarting the docker service seemingly has a number of negative
implications on an overcloud. When we added --live-restore to docker
we assumed that we were covered in most cases. The only left out
case was the 'upgrade the docker rpm' one, where we actually
stopped all containers, stopped docker, upgraded the packages
and then started docker again (this was done with the minor updates
task)

The problem with restarting docker (apparently only with the
--live-restore) seems to be that we actually get the daemon in a hanging
state (see RHBZ#1566439 and the many deadlock mentions on github).

So let's prototype a way to actually *not* restart the docker service
when a configuration change happens.

Let's consider four scenarios:
A) Initial deploy
This is untouched by the patch and works as before

B) Re-deploy against an existing overcloud
This is probably one of the most problematic ones, because the following
might happen.
B.1) A docker config change will trigger a docker service restart
B.2) The docker service restart will happen more or less at the same
time on all controller nodes.
B.3) Massive service desruption ensues and potentially pacemaker will
fail resources as well and can potentially fence nodes if stopping
a resource fails.

With this patch we'd avoid this situation by simply never restarting
docker (it can still be restarted via a minor update workflow)

C) Minor updates
Here if we detect a config change via puppet or a docker package upgrade
we do the following:
C.1) We stop all containers and then docker
C.2) We update the package
C.3) We rerun puppet
C.4) We start docker

With this patch we need to make sure that we do not rely on puppet to
start the service but we need to do it via ansible in the update
task.

D) Major upgrades
We would not restart docker. It would be restarted (if needed) via a
minor update (either the one before the major upgrade, or one
afterwards)

Change-Id: I75a0e200b96cc5057c95d7f892eb9f23bb97a042

commit_message:
Do not assume OS release

The ceilometer charm was assuming grizzly before the ceilometer-common
package was installed to determine the OS release. On queens deploys
this breaks due packages not being installed.

If ceilomter-common is not installed return empty configs.

Change-Id: Ib8bc1b7be3595bd8e64a25d0444dd768b80de881
Closes-Bug: #1759301

commit_message:
Convert fping API to processutils.execute()

Now that we don't have any calls to execute things as root,
it makes sense to move to just calling processutils.execute()
directly instead of going through our own redirection layer
which doesn't really do much.

Convert fping to call processutils directly.

Change-Id: I70a2646f2aa700ac796e0db3f79c41ca518162ea

commit_message:
Use .. deprecated:: theme for deprecations

We were using `warning`, and `important` themes to mark deprecations in
various places.  We have a `deprecated` role, so this change switches to
use it.

Note that I also found the following files that mentioned deprecation,
but not in a way where using this role seemed appropriate.  I'm
recording them here so you know I considered them.

doc/source/admin/configuration/hypervisor-kvm.rst
doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst
doc/source/cli/index.rst
doc/source/cli/nova-rootwrap.rst
doc/source/contributor/api.rst
doc/source/contributor/code-review.rst
doc/source/contributor/policies.rst
doc/source/contributor/project-scope.rst
doc/source/reference/policy-enforcement.rst
doc/source/reference/stable-api.rst
doc/source/user/feature-classification.rst
doc/source/user/flavors.rst
doc/source/user/upgrade.rst

Change-Id: Icd7613d9886cfe0775372c817e5f3d07d8fb553d

commit_message:
Allow configuration of NFS backend for Nova

Allow NFS configuration of storage backend for Nova.
This way the instances files will be stored on a shared
NFS storage.

Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

Change-Id: I4ce73bbf4158c51effc9828031f7b51303d9b89f

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-04-28 20:32:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'log stale allocations as WARNING instead of DEBUG

Stale resource allocations can prevent Nova from scheduling new
instances on a host that otherwise has sufficient resources available.
Nova would log a message about this situation on the affected compute
node, but it was logged at DEBUG priority and so would typically not
be visible in a production environment.

This commit modifies Nova to log the message as a warning instead.

Change-Id: I347d2ab0077c4d9b62bc169af9e039d00ec214fa
Closes-bug: #1767553
'}]
commit_message:
log stale allocations as WARNING instead of DEBUG

Stale resource allocations can prevent Nova from scheduling new
instances on a host that otherwise has sufficient resources available.
Nova would log a message about this situation on the affected compute
node, but it was logged at DEBUG priority and so would typically not
be visible in a production environment.

This commit modifies Nova to log the message as a warning instead.

Change-Id: I347d2ab0077c4d9b62bc169af9e039d00ec214fa
Closes-bug: #1767553

subject: Log useful information in the API log
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-31 20:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Log useful information in the API log

heat-api doesn't routinely log anything above DEBUG level, and then most of
the information comes from random middleware like version_negotiation. Log
the actual request at INFO level, and remove useless information like the
address in memory of the Controller object from the debug logs.

Change-Id: I5bb115abd31b4050e608e913058b6955b4bddc5a
"}]
commit_message:
Log useful information in the API log

heat-api doesn't routinely log anything above DEBUG level, and then most of
the information comes from random middleware like version_negotiation. Log
the actual request at INFO level, and remove useless information like the
address in memory of the Controller object from the debug logs.

Change-Id: I5bb115abd31b4050e608e913058b6955b4bddc5a
